metadata.title: CVE-2020-25592 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In SaltStack Salt through 3002, salt-netapi improperly validates eauthcredentials and tokens. A user can bypass authentication and invoke SaltSSH.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25592` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

salt-api - 2015.8.8+ds-1ubuntu0.1+esm2
salt-cloud - 2015.8.8+ds-1ubuntu0.1+esm2
salt-common - 2015.8.8+ds-1ubuntu0.1+esm2
salt-master - 2015.8.8+ds-1ubuntu0.1+esm2
salt-minion - 2015.8.8+ds-1ubuntu0.1+esm2
salt-proxy - 2015.8.8+ds-1ubuntu0.1+esm2
salt-ssh - 2015.8.8+ds-1ubuntu0.1+esm2
salt-syndic - 2015.8.8+ds-1ubuntu0.1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: salt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2015.8.8+ds-1ubuntu0.1+esm2').
